channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Beneath flat 1 Leff house infront of the garage, 3rd February
item.description:
Reported earlier and 2 lime operatives have repositioned the bike blocking the entrance to the garage, prior to this it was at the side so cars could still enter

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Winchester Avenue, Kilburn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree root lifting pavement, 3rd February
item.description:
Resident has called to report tree root is lifting public pavement up and could cause a trip hazard. Please can this be looked into.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Brabourne Rise, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned and partially dismantled fridge/freezer, 3rd February
item.description:
Has been there for quite a while. Has been reported by others and claimed to be fixed but it was still there at 11.30am 3/2/2026 so I photographed it and I am reporting it again. It is located on a footpath not the road so not obviously visible from the road as the road and the footpath are at different heights.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Shoreham Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paper bin standing by garages being filled with all sorts, 3rd February
item.description:
The paper bin has been left at the side of the Garages under No, 14 for some months, has occasionally been emptied but is currently overflowing with all sorts including food wrappers and is attracting vermin
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Talehangers Close, Blendon, Greater London

item.title: Dumped cabinet, 3rd February

Cabinet/sideboard on Hylton street. Dumped overnight.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brookdene Road, Plumstead

item.title: Right outside off parking space of number 5 Mowbray Road., 3rd February
item.description:
A sinking gutter is becoming a serious safety hazard as lately the area surrounding the gutter is collapsing every day in the last week. Could someone look into it as I had reported the same issue 3 times in the last 3 years and keep coming back. It looks like the drainage is out of alignment, cracked or totally broken and every heavy rain day it removes the ground around the gutter and start to collapse. I really appreciate the quick response and solution, but, the solution is only temporarily as it keeps coming back. I look forward to seeing the works to be done shortly before an incident takes place. Many thanks and regards

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mowbray Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of Rubbish constantly left by the Bus Stop, 3rd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, West Heath, Greater London

item.title: These bikes are taking over our residential parking spaces. Why should I pay for parking when I cannot find a space to park my car? Parking is very expensive in this borough. Hackney needs to get rid of bike parking and restore our bays., 3rd February
item.description:
These bikes are parked all over the place, pavements, residential parked bays, on the road etc. These bikes need to be banned and hackney needs to restore our residential parking bays. Why should we pay for parking when these bikes are taking over

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Calvert Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
